Yagi

Typhoon Yagi, also known as Super Typhoon Yagi or "Enteng" in the Philippines, was a powerful tropical cyclone in 2024. It originated in late August and rapidly intensified over the Philippine Sea, reaching peak winds of 235 km/h (145 mph), making it a Category 4-equivalent storm. Yagi caused significant damage as it moved westward, making landfall in the Philippines, southern China, and Vietnam. In Vietnam alone, the storm left over 80 people dead and millions without power, triggering landslides and severe flooding. It was one of the most devastating storms of the 2024 season.
